summary: In 2017 and 2018, the Attorney General directed federal prosecutors to prioritize prosecutions of immigration-related offenses such as improper entry, illegal reentry after a prior removal, and alien smuggling. We reviewed actions the Departments of Justice and Homeland Security and the federal judiciary took in response. DOJ offices along the southwest border all increased immigration-related prosecutions Misdemeanor improper entry cases more than doubled to about...
title: Immigration Enforcement: Immigration-Related Prosecutions Increased from 2017 to 2018 in Response to U.S. Attorney General's Direction
